definition: to put one's palms together (in prayer or greeting)
100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗
to close/to join/to fit/to be equal to/whole/together/round (in battle)/conjunction (astronomy)/1st note of pentatonic scale/old variant of 盒[he2]
ten/10

sentences.chinese: 隱士舉手合十在他的額頂。

sentences.english: Practice spinning poi in a corkscrew by keeping hands together.
sentences.chinese: 實踐中的螺旋狀旋轉的POI通過保持雙手合十。

sentences.english: Cross the figer! God bless me! Perhapes the present is the happiness.
sentences.chinese: 雙手合十，祝福一下，或許現在真得是很幸福的。

sentences.english: Press feet, sitz bones, crown. If flexibility allows, bring palms together at elbow level.
sentences.chinese: 雙腳下壓，身體自頭頂向上，雙手於肘水平方向合十。

sentences.english: For example, in Thailand, people greet each other using the wai.
sentences.chinese: 比如，在泰國，人們用合十禮來相互打招呼。

sentences.english: Fold the palms together in front of the chest and rest the thumbs against the breastbone in a prayer position.
sentences.chinese: 雙手合十到胸前，大拇指置於胸骨的位置，祈禱式。

sentences.english: Lie on your back with the soles of your feet together and your knees bent and dropping toward the floor.
sentences.chinese: 首先平躺，兩腳底合十，兩膝微曲放在地板上。

sentences.english: Namaste is a basic manner in Thailand.
sentences.chinese: 雙手合十是泰國最基本的禮節。

sentences.english: He folds his hands together, waiting for your extending hand.
sentences.chinese: 牠雙手合十，等待你伸出友善的手。

sentences.english: She has her palms together, as if praying.
They gaze on the darkness, they kneel, and they clasp their hands.
sentences.chinese: 他們注視着黑影，他們雙膝跪下，兩手合十。

sentences.english: Salu and Namaste, I AM Mohammed.
sentences.chinese: 祝福，合十，我是穆罕默德。

definition: to clasp hands/to put one's palms together (in prayer)
one of the many names of Buddha
Amitabha Buddha/the Buddha of the Western paradise/may the lord Buddha preserve us!/merciful Buddha!
to bow with hands held in front
to return a politeness/to present a gift in return
to sit in the lotus position
to bow down low/to make obeisance/to kneel and bow
benefactor (term used by a monk to address a layperson)/donor (semiconductor)
to kowtow/also written 磕頭|磕头[ke1 tou2]
(Buddhism) benefactor (designation of a lay person by a monk)
poor monk (humble term used by monk of himself)
to read out/to recite/to remember sb (while talking about sth else)
to greet by raising clasped hands
to cup one fist in the other hand (as a sign of respect)
silent prayer/pray in silence
to bow deeply, starting upright with arms straight out in front, one hand cupped in the other, then moving the hands down to one's knees as one bows, keeping the arms straight (a form of greeting)
